intro: Senecio brevilimbus, commonly known as the narrow-lobed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are surrounded by pale green bracts, and its leaves are usually narrow and slightly lobed. Senecio brevilimbus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and fynbos vegetation.
